channel.title: Vps
channel.description: Hi im looking for a good and cheap (10$) vps host where i can have like 50 people online with no lagg.

There’s your answer.

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Rshahine, post:24, topic:375311”]Sooo what the est server i could use (317)

Offtopic: thanks for helping me out :d[/quote]

You’re most likely new to RSPS, and the way they operate.

You might want to look at these,

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Though you should use more applied bases until you understand the above.

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Rshahine, post:22, topic:375311”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=471264.msg3446928#msg3446928 date=1293496181]

Should this be enough for a windows?

512MB RAM
512MB Dedicated RAM
50GB RAID 10 Storage
2TB Bandwidth
Windows 2003 or 2008

Well, this draws back to my original point of how well programmed your server is. You’d need to give the JVM more RAM and remember that the OS uses RAM also. I’d recommend 1GB for the sake off it though I don’t know what server you use.

It really depends what you’re aiming for.

Hmm im aiming for 50 player online with no lagg.

So my guess is linux uses less ram then windows thats why linux is better?

You’ll never achieve 0 lagg, they’ll always be some lagg, especially using Delta.
[/quote]

When i use PI my chance of getting lagg is less then when i use delta?[/quote]

I believe PI has better networking capabilities then Delta, and is packaged but it’s not the BEST server you could use. Thought it’d be an improvement.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Rshahine, post:12, topic:375311”]Soo… Whats exactly thedifference between linux and windows.
Price difference?[/quote]

Linux is freely distributed. You can get it here:

http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/download

That is just one distribution, there are many. I recommend Ubuntu if you’re a beginner. Also,

http://blogs.techrepublic.com.com/10things/?p=406

Read full topic

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Rshahine, post:9, topic:375311”]Sooo… What do you guys mean with linux?
Because im using w7. And i dont know how linux works… Is linux better?[/quote]
Linux would be better for hosting, though it’s not as user-friendly as Windows, and you’ll most likely break something. Though it’s your money.

item.title: Vps
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Rshahine:

I dont wanna have my computer on 24/7 or any other device so i really need a vps

Protips:

[ul][li]Don’t use VPSland[/li][li]If you’re unsure on using Linux, don’t use it.[/li][li]Only use what you’re comfortable with.[/li][/ul]

Simply look at sites like Frantech, SWSvps etc
